extractions.description: This paper investigates the occurrence and nature of self-admitted technical debt (SATD) in machine learning (ML) software. By analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains and comparing them with 318 non-ML projects, it aims to understand the prevalence, composition, and evolution of SATD in ML code.

title.value: An Empirical Study of Self-Admitted Technical Debt in Machine Learning Software
title.justification: This title accurately encapsulates the research focus of the study which investigates self-admitted technical debt in machine learning software.
title.quote: An Empirical Study of Self-Admitted Technical Debt in Machine Learning Software

type.justification: The study relies on empirical evidence collected from the analysis of open-source ML and non-ML projects to draw its conclusions.
type.quote: This paper aims to investigate the occurrence of SATD in ML code by analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains, along with 318 non-ML projects.

research_field.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on machine learning software and the technical debt associated with it.
research_field.quote: Given our different dataset, our qualitative results complement the results of Obrien et al. and provide a broader understanding of the prevalence and impact of debt across different datasets and domains.

sub_research_field.justification: The study specifically addresses technical debt, particularly self-admitted technical debt, within the context of machine learning software.
sub_research_field.quote: This paper aims to investigate the occurrence of SATD in ML code by analyzing 318 open-source ML projects across five domains, along with 318 non-ML projects.

name.justification: The paper references using SVM as a part of technical debt illustration.
name.quote: Using a traditional ML model, say SVM, for image classification would require manual feature extraction (e.g., SIFT).

type.justification: SVM (Support Vector Machine) is a widely used traditional machine learning model.
type.quote: Using a traditional ML model, say SVM, for image classification would require manual feature extraction (e.g., SIFT).

name.justification: The paper references CNN as an advanced model to overcome limitations of traditional models.
name.quote: Paying off this TD by upgrading SVM to a Deep Learning model like CNN can itself cause massive ripple effects across multiple components.

type.justification: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are a type of deep learning model.
type.quote: Paying off this TD by upgrading SVM to a Deep Learning model like CNN can itself cause massive ripple effects across multiple components.

name.justification: Mentioned multiple times as a popular ML toolkit/framework.
name.quote: The advent of popular ML toolkits, ™ such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Auto ML, has enabled developers to easily leverage state-of-the-art ML algorithms.

name.justification: Explicitly mentioned as a popular ML toolkit/framework.
name.quote: The advent of popular ML toolkits, ™ such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Auto ML, has enabled developers to easily leverage state-of-the-art ML algorithms.

name.justification: Recognized as a popular library for implementing ML algorithms.
name.quote: The advent of popular ML toolkits, ™ such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, and Auto ML, has enabled developers to easily leverage state-of-the-art ML algorithms.
